{"title":"Section 9, Page 4","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"ARTICLE IV.
The duty of the Solicitor shall be to give his legal advice and
counsel when consulted ; to represent the Company in all the Court,
of Law or Equity, in suits to which they may be a party ; t0 giTe
his professional services and attention in the preparation of all acts
or other writings in which they may be interested ; and to afford any
other professional aid that may he required of him by the President
or the Board. His salary shall be $500 per annum, payable monthly
ARTICLE V.
It shall be the duty of the Engineer to perform all duties which
appertain to his department of the service; to exercise a general
and personal supervision and control over his corps in the suhordinate
duties which may be assigned them ; to make weekly reports to the
Board, detailing the progress of his operations, and all other material
information connected with his work, or otherwise of interest to the
Company, and to strictly conform to the orders of the President and
the Board. His salary shall he $ per annum, payable monthly
upon the warrant of the President.
ARTICLE VI.
The duty of the Superintendent shall consist in obedience to and
performance of all orders and instructions given him by the Direction,
in whatever branch or department of service that may be assigned
to him. His salary shall be $2000 per annum, payable monthly upon
the warrant of the President.
